Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Animal Chalice or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (mostly worn); exterior: double guilloche band above three broad bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The exterior decoration is typical of the decoration on the lower part of Mature Animal Style and Grand Style chalices and chalice kraters. The thickness and size of the sherd suggest that the vase was a heavy chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1623) (phase 2)
